Class Organism

  • java.lang.Object
    • Organism
  • abstract class Organism
extends java.lang.Object
    Organism is an abstract class that all living creatures inherit their base code from. All organisms have a reference to an Ecosystem that represents the shared world that they inhabit with one another. Organisms have a position (integer coordinates) within this world and remain alive until they are eaten or die of some other cause.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Organism

        Organism​(Ecosystem world,
         int x,
         int y)
        Constructor for Organisms. Since Organism is an abstract class, this can never be called directly to make "Organism objects". However, it is still convenient to have a constructor so that objects of the subclasses can be created more efficiently.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        abstract void update()
        Allows the organism to perform the actions it wishes to perform while the simulation is running. Each distinct species must override this method to allow movement, eating, and any other survival strategies it knows how to perform during its turn.

      • getDistanceTo

        int getDistanceTo​(Organism otherOrg)
        Returns the grid-based distance between this organism and the other organism. In the square grid used by Ecosystem, vertical, horizontal, and diagonal movements are each considered 1 unit of distance. Therefore the "distance" between two organisms will be the minimum number of moves between them rather than the usual Pythagorean distance.
        Parameters:
        otherOrg - The other organism that this organism will measure the distance to.

      • hasSameLocationAs

        boolean hasSameLocationAs​(Organism otherOrg)
        Returns true if the distance between this organism and the other organism is zero. Two organisms have the same location if their coordinates are the same, or equivalently if the distance between them is zero.
        Returns:
        True if this organism has the same location as the other organism, and false otherwise.

      • getNearest

        Organism getNearest​(java.lang.Class species)
        Finds the nearest living organism of the given species to this organism or null if none can be found. For instance, a rabbit object might call this.getNearest(Grass.class) in its search for food, this.getNearest(Fox.class) to sense if it is in danger, or this.getNearest(Rabbit.class) to search for a mate. An object calling this method is guaranteed to NOT receive itself back as a return value!
        Parameters:
        species - The class of the target species to search for.
        Returns:
        The nearest living organism object matching the given species or null.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Displays the species name along with its coordinates. This string of text will display whenever an object inheriting from this class is passed into System.out.println(). For instance, printing a grass object will display something like "Grass[5, 19]" instead of the memory location of the object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
